bug.short_desc: Package BIRT Trace Report component as an as-is component.

long_desc.thetext:
Package BIRT Trace Report component as an as-is component.
The following plug-ins and feature should be packaged as the BIRT Trace Report component:
Plugins: org.eclipse.tptp.trace.report.birt org.eclipse.tptp.trace.report.birt.doc.user
Feature: org.eclipse.tptp.trace.report.birt
Name: Business Intelligence and Reporting Tools (BIRT) Trace Reports
Description: Business Intelligence and Reporting Tools (BIRT) Trace Reports are used to aggregate and summarize numerous profiling events over a period of time (report window). The BIRT trace reports present profiling events in tables and charts so users can easily locate trends and effectually analyze.
Also, please remove the following plug-ins/features from the TPTP packages (run-time, SDK, update site):
Plugins: org.eclipse.tptp.trace.report.birt org.eclipse.tptp.trace.report.birt.ui org.eclipse.tptp.trace.report.birt.doc.user
Feature: org.eclipse.tptp.trace.report.birt
Finally, please remove the following plug-in from CVS: org.eclipse.tptp.trace.report.birt.ui
Joel: Please only remove the contents of the following plug-in in CVS: org.eclipse.tptp.trace.report.birt.ui

See(In reply to comment #0)
> Description: > Business Intelligence and Reporting Tools (BIRT) Trace Reports are used to > aggregate and summarize numerous profiling events over a period of time (report > window). The BIRT trace reports present profiling events in tables and charts > so users can easily locate trends and effectually analyze.
Correction:
Business Intelligence and Reporting Tools (BIRT) Trace Reports are used to aggregate and summarize numerous profiling events over a period of time. The BIRT trace reports present profiling events in tables and charts so users can easily locate trends and effectually analyze.

(In reply to comment #0)
> Finally, please remove the following plug-in from CVS: > org.eclipse.tptp.trace.report.birt.ui
Done!

The feature org.eclipse.tptp.trace.report.birt has been moved to the as-is section. I have removed the feature from the SDK and source generation. I have also removed the feature from the Trace Runtime.
